Dear Mark,

Thank you for reaching out regarding Union Trust Bank’s approach to handling customer disputes. Below is a succinct overview of the framework we follow to ensure complaints are addressed promptly, transparently, and in line with consumer-protection regulations:

1. Intake & Acknowledgment
   • Customers can lodge a dispute through our secure online portal, by phone, or in person at any branch.
   • A unique reference number is generated immediately and shared with the customer for tracking purposes.

2. Preliminary Assessment
   • Our dedicated Disputes Team reviews the claim to confirm eligibility and gathers any supporting documentation needed from the customer.

3. Merchant / Third-Party Engagement (when applicable)
   • We contact the merchant or external party involved to obtain their response and relevant transaction records.

4. Evaluation & Decision
   • The Disputes Team analyses all information, applicable regulations, and card-network rules to determine the appropriate outcome.

5. Communication & Remediation
   • The customer is notified in writing of the decision and the rationale behind it.
   • Where warranted, we arrange provisional or permanent account adjustments (e.g., credits or refunds).

6. Escalation Options
   • If a customer remains dissatisfied, they may request an internal appeal or escalate the matter to the relevant external ombudsman or regulatory body. We provide clear instructions for doing so in every final response.

Throughout the process we aim to resolve cases within prescribed timeframes and keep customers updated on progress. Continuous auditing ensures adherence to both internal service standards and external regulatory requirements.

I hope this overview provides the clarity you need for your article. If you have any follow-up questions, please feel free to let me know.

Best regards,
Jane
Customer Service Representative
Union Trust Bank
